content.description: This boulder was really fun to send, the start is hairy because there are no good spots to put a crash pad, especially when you climb over the triangle shaped rock. Starting underneath the roof of the boulder your hands will start on the huge flake, then the under cling will guide you to the right where you'll squeeze through a gap made from the boulder and a possible flake that's fallen off. From there you'll start working the crack to top out. Like i said really fun boulder, sort of sketch landing on the first part but you will not regret trying out this roadside boulder problem.
content.protection: Bring a pad or two. Hopefully a spotter.
content.location: Park on the left side of the road of Redwood Dr. right before you get to Sequoia Crest. Very easy to recognize. Starts down under the roof of the boulder.

content.description: Reachy boulder, starts with jug then smaller holds from there on until the top out. This boulder will make you spread your wings and 'reach for the stars'. Crux has to be two last moves before topping out. Sequencing your moves right and good technique will help guide you through this boulder. Challenging but very fun boulder problem.
content.location: Head up Redwood drive and make the sharp right that's just passed the mailboxes as you drive into Sequoia Crest. Drive for about half of a mile and it will be on your left. You'll see the back side of the boulder first, the problem is on the side nearst the two giant Redwood trees standing next to the boulder, which are also a good indicator/landmark to help find this boulder problem.

content.description: Amazing traverse, start favors taller people for sure. Crux has to be transition where crack forms up the center of the boulder, plus the top out. Great crack traverse that allows you to explore and get creative with how you climb it. Juggy holds toward the middle allow for rest before top out to the side of the boulder.
content.protection: At least two crash pads or active spotter.
content.location: Same spot as Bryophyta, take Redwood drive to Sequoia Crest, sharp right at the mail boxes, take a left onto Manzanita Drive and drive to the end, this boulder is located up on the hillside, about 20 feet from where you park. You will not miss this boulder lol its huge.

content.description: Starts on eyelevel crimps, crux for me would be reaching out left over the lip of the problem to a slopish hold. Topping out is also tricky, luckily the last hold is a jug. This is a overhanging boulder that is great for climbers working on crimping and starting to climb overhanging boulders. Be careful of the moss, hence the name, its everywhere.
content.location: This boulder is located next to a few other problems as well. How you get there is to take Redwood drive until you enter Sequoia Crest and see the mail boxes on the right, make the sharp right turn just past the mail boxes and take that road for about another quarter mile, then make a left onto Manzanita Dr, go until it turns to dirt ( the road is maintained and is only about 500 feet long) then park where the road ends. The boulder will be just off of the end of the road.
